meanings.sent1: The bang of the door startled me.
meanings.sent2: I heard a loud bang coming from the fireworks.
meanings.sent3: The bang of the drum made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The bang of the thunder shook the windows.
meanings.sent5: The bang of the gunshot echoed through the night.

meanings.sent1: He felt a bang on his head after bumping into the wall.
meanings.sent2: The boxer delivered a powerful bang to his opponent's jaw.
meanings.sent3: The bang of the hammer on the nail was satisfying.
meanings.sent4: The bang of the ball hitting the bat was heard across the field.
meanings.sent5: The bang of the collision echoed in the empty room.

meanings.definition: To make a sudden loud noise
meanings.sent1: The fireworks bang loudly in the sky.
meanings.sent2: I accidentally made the door bang shut.
meanings.sent3: The kids love to bang on the drums during music class.
meanings.sent4: The wind caused the shutters to bang against the house.
meanings.sent5: The car's engine started to bang loudly.

meanings.sent1: She had to bang the jar on the counter to open it.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter needed to bang the nail into the wood.
meanings.sent3: He would bang the gavel to call for order in the court.
meanings.sent4: The waves would bang against the rocks on the shore.
meanings.sent5: The chef would bang the dough to knead it properly.

meanings.sent1: The characters in the movie decided to bang in the bedroom scene.
meanings.sent2: Some birds bang to reproduce and have babies.
meanings.sent3: The monkeys in the zoo were caught banging on camera.
meanings.sent4: The teenagers were giggling about who would bang whom at the party.
meanings.sent5: The animals in the wild bang to continue their species.
